page.title: 08THE OAST TONBRIDGE:2 PLAYS
page.content: The theatre was full of all age groups_a varied audience.Seats are Â£2, or Â£1.25 for members.There were two 75 minute plays _{Man of Destiny}_ by G.Bernard Shaw,about Napoleon Bona- parte,set in an Italian inn,around 1796.{The Real Inspector Hound},by Tom Stoppard followed.This was a spoof of an Agatha Christie "Who dunnit?" thriller set in Muldoon Manor,cut off from the world by fog,with a murderer on the loose.A corpse lies unnoticed by the sofa.The plot thickens when one of two critics from the audience answers a telephone call on stage from his wife and involves himself in the action.In the final scene both critics are shot and the real Inspector Hound reveals himself as another minor failed critic.This is comedy:when it is played seriously it seems so absurd that it is humorous.
